knimeNode.name: Container Output (File)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Makes a file in the workflow accessible to an external caller.

fullDescription.intro:
This node makes a file accessible to an external caller (for example the REST interface) by providing the path to the file as a resource. The file has to exist and be located in the current workflow's data area.
This uses node a
path flow variables
to select which file to expose. To convert the string variables created by some nodes that have not been migrated yet to paths you can use the String to Path (Variable) node. For further information about file handling in general see the File Handling Guide.
fullDescription.option:
A name for the variable output parameter (preferably unique). This name is exposed in the REST interface and will have the resource attached to it. It must start with a letter, followed by letters and digits and single minus signs or dashes and must end with a letter.
(The accepted pattern is described by the following regular expression: ^[a-zA-Z](?:[-_]?[a-zA-Z0-9]+)*(?<![0-9])$)

option.name: Append unique ID to parameter name

fullDescription.option: If checked, the name set above will be amended by the node's ID to guarantee unique parameter names. Usually it's a good idea to have this box not checked and instead make sure to use meaningful and unique names in all container nodes present in a workflow.
A description for the resource output parameter. The description is shown in the API specification of the REST interface.

Defines the variable that contains the path to the resource to be exposed. This has to be a
path flow variable.
The path must point to a file that exists, must be regular (e.g. not a folder) and must be contained in the current workflow's data area.
